findings.title: ST - Stops Transactions
findings.description: The contract owner has the authority to stop transactions for all users excluding the owner, and may take advantage of it by setting the `maxBuyTransactionAmount` to zero.

findings.title: RSV - Redundant State Variables
findings.description: The contract uses global variables as temporary variables for the amount that the corresponding address will receive on each transaction. These variables are not used anywhere else in the contract and are redundant.

findings.title: DDP - Decimal Division Precision
findings.description: Division of decimal (fixed point) numbers can result in rounding errors due to the way that division is implemented in Solidity, leading to issues with precise calculations with decimal numbers.

findings.title: RSML - Redundant SafeMath Library
findings.description: The usage of the SafeMath library adds complexity and overhead, increasing gas consumption unnecessarily since Solidity versions 0.8.0 and above have native functionality for arithmetic operations that revert to underflow and overflow.

findings.title: IDI - Immutable Declaration Improvement
findings.description: The contract is using variables that initialize them only in the constructor and are not mutated by other functions, but these variables are not defined as `immutable`.

findings.title: L04 - Conformance to Solidity Naming Conventions
findings.description: The Solidity style guide provides guidelines for writing clean and consistent Solidity code, including conventions for naming functions, variables, contracts, structs, enums, and constants. Adhering to these conventions can improve the readability and maintainability of the code.

findings.title: L05 - Unused State Variable
findings.description: An unused state variable is a state variable that is declared in the contract, but is never used in any of the contract's functions. This can happen if the state variable was originally intended to be used, but was later removed or never used.

findings.title: L07 - Missing Events Arithmetic
findings.description: Events are a way to record and log information about changes or actions that occur within a contract.

findings.title: L09 - Dead Code Elimination
findings.description: Dead code can make a contract more difficult to understand and maintain, and can also increase the size of the contract and the cost of deploying and interacting with it.

findings.title: L13 - Divide before Multiply Operation
findings.description: Performing divisions before multiplications may cause a loss of precision.

findings.title: L15 - Local Scope Variable Shadowing
findings.description: Local scope variable shadowing occurs when a local variable with the same name as a variable in an outer scope is declared within a function or code block.

findings.title: L16 - Validate Variable Setters
findings.description: The contract performs operations on variables configured by user-supplied input without proper checks for zero values, leading to potential problems during execution.
